metadata.name: Firewall Rule Deleted Via Netsh.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the removal of a port or application rule in the Windows Firewall configuration using netsh

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\netsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('netsh.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('firewall')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('delete ')) AND NOT (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\dropbox.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('name=dropbox'))))

output.summary: Detects the removal of a port or application rule in the Windows Firewall configuration using netsh

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate administration activity 2. Software installations and removal Reference: https://app.any.run/tasks/8bbd5b4c-b82d-4e6d-a3ea-d454594a37cc/
